trans-unit.source: Service Bus Authentication and Authorization
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Authentication and Authorization

trans-unit.source: Applications can authenticate to <token>sb1</token> using either <newTerm>Shared Access Signature</newTerm> (SAS) authentication, or by authenticating through the <token>firstref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Applications can authenticate to <token>sb1</token> using either <newTerm>Shared Access Signature</newTerm> (SAS) authentication, or by authenticating through the <token>firstref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Shared Access Signature authentication enables applications to authenticate to <token>sb2</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the entity with which specific rights are associated.
trans-unit.target: Shared Access Signature authentication enables applications to authenticate to <token>sb2</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the entity with which specific rights are associated.

trans-unit.source: You can then use this key to generate a Shared Access Signature token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can then use this key to generate a Shared Access Signature token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: SAS provides a simple, flexible, and easy-to-use authentication scheme for <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: SAS provides a simple, flexible, and easy-to-use authentication scheme for <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Applications can use SAS in scenarios in which they do not need to manage the notion of an authorized “user.”
trans-unit.target: Applications can use SAS in scenarios in which they do not need to manage the notion of an authorized “user.”

trans-unit.source: Shared Access Signature Authentication
trans-unit.target: Shared Access Signature Authentication

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication enables you to grant a user access to <token>sb2</token> resources with specific rights.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication enables you to grant a user access to <token>sb2</token> resources with specific rights.

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication in <token>sb2</token> involves the configuration of a cryptographic key with associated rights on a <token>sb2</token> resource.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication in <token>sb2</token> involves the configuration of a cryptographic key with associated rights on a <token>sb2</token> resource.

trans-unit.source: Clients can then gain access to that resource by presenting a SAS token which consists of the resource URI being accessed and an expiry signed with the configured key.
trans-unit.target: Clients can then gain access to that resource by presenting a SAS token which consists of the resource URI being accessed and an expiry signed with the configured key.

trans-unit.source: You can configure keys for SAS on a <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: You can configure keys for SAS on a <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: The key applies to all messaging entities in that namespace.
trans-unit.target: The key applies to all messaging entities in that namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure keys on <token>sb2</token> queues, topics, and notification hubs.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure keys on <token>sb2</token> queues, topics, and notification hubs.

trans-unit.source: SAS is also supported on <token>sb2</token> relays.
trans-unit.target: SAS is also supported on <token>sb2</token> relays.

trans-unit.source: To use SAS, you can configure a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object on a namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub that consists of the following:
trans-unit.target: To use SAS, you can configure a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object on a namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub that consists of the following:

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic>KeyName</legacyItalic> that identifies the rule.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic>KeyName</legacyItalic> that identifies the rule.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic>PrimaryKey</legacyItalic> is a cryptographic key used to sign/validate SAS tokens.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic>PrimaryKey</legacyItalic> is a cryptographic key used to sign/validate SAS tokens.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic>SecondaryKey</legacyItalic> is a cryptographic key used to sign/validate SAS tokens.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic>SecondaryKey</legacyItalic> is a cryptographic key used to sign/validate SAS tokens.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic>Rights</legacyItalic> representing the collection of Listen, Send, or Manage rights granted.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic>Rights</legacyItalic> representing the collection of Listen, Send, or Manage rights granted.

trans-unit.source: Authorization rules configured at the namespace level can grant access to all entities in a namespace for clients with tokens signed using the corresponding key.
trans-unit.target: Authorization rules configured at the namespace level can grant access to all entities in a namespace for clients with tokens signed using the corresponding key.

trans-unit.source: Up to 12 such authorization rules can be configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Up to 12 such authorization rules can be configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, queue, topic, or notification hub.

trans-unit.source: By default, a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> with all rights is configured for every namespace when it is first provisioned.
trans-unit.target: By default, a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> with all rights is configured for every namespace when it is first provisioned.

trans-unit.source: To access an entity, the client requires a SAS token generated using a specific <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: To access an entity, the client requires a SAS token generated using a specific <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The SAS token is generated using the HMAC-SHA256 of a resource string that consists of the resource URI to which access is claimed, and an expiry with a cryptographic key associated with the authorization rule.
trans-unit.target: The SAS token is generated using the HMAC-SHA256 of a resource string that consists of the resource URI to which access is claimed, and an expiry with a cryptographic key associated with the authorization rule.

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication support for <token>sb2</token> is included in the Azure .NET SDK versions 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication support for <token>sb2</token> is included in the Azure .NET SDK versions 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: SAS includes support for a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: SAS includes support for a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: All APIs that accept a connection string as a parameter include support for SAS connection strings.
trans-unit.target: All APIs that accept a connection string as a parameter include support for SAS connection strings.

trans-unit.source: ACS authentication
trans-unit.target: ACS authentication

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> authentication through <token>secondref_acs</token> is managed through a companion “-sb” <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> authentication through <token>secondref_acs</token> is managed through a companion “-sb” <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: If you want a companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace to be created for a <token>sb2</token> namespace, you cannot create your <token>sb2</token> namespace using the Azure management portal; you must create the namespace using the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureSBNamespace</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn495165.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you want a companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace to be created for a <token>sb2</token> namespace, you cannot create your <token>sb2</token> namespace using the Azure management portal; you must create the namespace using the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureSBNamespace</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn495165.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: To avoid creating an <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace, issue the following command:
trans-unit.target: To avoid creating an <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace, issue the following command:

trans-unit.source: For example, if you create a <token>sb2</token> namespace called <embeddedLabel>contoso.servicebus.windows.net</embeddedLabel>, a companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace called <embeddedLabel>contoso-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net</embeddedLabel> is provisioned automatically.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you create a <token>sb2</token> namespace called <embeddedLabel>contoso.servicebus.windows.net</embeddedLabel>, a companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace called <embeddedLabel>contoso-sb.accesscontrol.windows.net</embeddedLabel> is provisioned automatically.

trans-unit.source: For all namespaces that were created before August 2014, an accompanying <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace was created.
trans-unit.target: For all namespaces that were created before August 2014, an accompanying <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace was created.

trans-unit.source: A default service identity “owner,” with all rights, is provisioned by default in this companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: A default service identity “owner,” with all rights, is provisioned by default in this companion <token>secondref_acs</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain fine-grained control to any <token>sb2</token> entity through <token>secondref_acs</token> by configuring the appropriate trust relationships.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain fine-grained control to any <token>sb2</token> entity through <token>secondref_acs</token> by configuring the appropriate trust relationships.

trans-unit.source: You can configure additional service identities for managing access to <token>sb2</token> entities.
trans-unit.target: You can configure additional service identities for managing access to <token>sb2</token> entities.

trans-unit.source: To access an entity, the client requests an SWT token from <token>secondref_acs</token> with the appropriate claims by presenting its credentials.
trans-unit.target: To access an entity, the client requests an SWT token from <token>secondref_acs</token> with the appropriate claims by presenting its credentials.

trans-unit.source: The SWT token must then be sent as a part of the request to <token>sb2</token> to enable the authorization of the client for access to the entity.
trans-unit.target: The SWT token must then be sent as a part of the request to <token>sb2</token> to enable the authorization of the client for access to the entity.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> authentication support for <token>sb2</token> is included in the Azure .NET SDK versions 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> authentication support for <token>sb2</token> is included in the Azure .NET SDK versions 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: This authentication includes support for a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedSecretTokenProvider</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: This authentication includes support for a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedSecretTokenProvider</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: All APIs that accept a connection string as a parameter include support for <token>secondref_acs</token> connection strings.
trans-unit.target: All APIs that accept a connection string as a parameter include support for <token>secondref_acs</token> connection strings.
